q: The greatest of empires, is the empire over one's self.
h:
“The greatest of empires, is the empire over one's self.” —
Publilius Syrus

q: Misfortune shows those who are not really friends.
h:
“Misfortune shows those who are not really friends.” —
Aristotle

q: If what you're doing is not your passion, you have nothing to lose.
h:
“If what you're doing is not your passion, you have nothing to lose.” —
Celestine Chua

q: The temptation to give up is strongest just before victory.
h:
“The temptation to give up is strongest just before victory.” —
Zen Proverb

q: Always remember that you are absolutely unique. Just like everyone else.
h:
“Always remember that you are absolutely unique. Just like everyone else. ” —
Margaret Mead

q: I never dwell on what happened. You can't change it. Move forward.
h:
“I never dwell on what happened. You can't change it. Move forward.” —
Joan Rivers

q: A crisis is an opportunity riding the dangerous wind.
h:
“A crisis is an opportunity riding the dangerous wind.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: Courage is almost a contradiction in terms. It means a strong desire to live taking the form of a readiness to die.
h:
“Courage is almost a contradiction in terms. It means a strong desire to live taking the form of a readiness to die.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: A hut full of laughter is richer than a palace full of sadness.
h:
“A hut full of laughter is richer than a palace full of sadness.” —
Zen Proverb

q: At the end of the day, let there be no excuses, no explanations, no regrets.
h:
“At the end of the day, let there be no excuses, no explanations, no regrets.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: The secret of happiness, you see, is not found in seeking more, but in developing the capacity to enjoy less.
h:
“The secret of happiness, you see, is not found in seeking more, but in developing the capacity to enjoy less.” —
Dan Millman

q: Get busy living, or get busy dying.
h:
“Get busy living, or get busy dying.” —
Stephen King

q: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
h:
“Happiness depends upon ourselves.” —
Aristotle

q: Embody what you teach, and teach only what you have embodied.
h:
“Embody what you teach, and teach only what you have embodied.” —
Dan Millman

q: When you've got nothing, you've got nothing to lose.
h:
“When you've got nothing, you've got nothing to lose.” —
Bob Dylan

q: Be where your enemy is not.
h:
“Be where your enemy is not.” —
Sun Tzu

q: If you aren't sure which way to do something, do it both ways and see which works better.
h:
“If you aren't sure which way to do something, do it both ways and see which works better.” —
John Carmack

q: An ounce of performance is worth pounds of promises.
h:
“An ounce of performance is worth pounds of promises.” —
Mae West

q: Our virtues and our failings are inseparable, like force and matter. When they separate, man is no more.
h:
“Our virtues and our failings are inseparable, like force and matter. When they separate, man is no more. ” —
Nikola Tesla

q: When everything seems to be going against you, remember that the airplane takes off against the wind, not with it.
h:
“When everything seems to be going against you, remember that the airplane takes off against the wind, not with it. ” —
Henry Ford

q: Decide whether or not the goal is worth the risks involved. If it is, stop worrying.
h:
“Decide whether or not the goal is worth the risks involved. If it is, stop worrying.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: The difference between winning and losing is most often not quitting.
h:
“The difference between winning and losing is most often not quitting.” —
Walt Disney

q: A needle is not sharp at both ends.
h:
“A needle is not sharp at both ends. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: If you can see it in your mind, you can hold it in your mind.
h:
“If you can see it in your mind, you can hold it in your mind.” —
Steve Harvey

q: Your conscience is the measure of the honesty of your selfishness. Listen to it carefully.
h:
“Your conscience is the measure of the honesty of your selfishness. Listen to it carefully.” —
Richard Bach

q: Follow your instincts. That is where true wisdom manifests itself.
h:
“Follow your instincts. That is where true wisdom manifests itself.” —
Oprah Winfrey

q: We ordinary people must forge our own beauty.
h:
“We ordinary people must forge our own beauty.” —
Kenji Miyazawa

q: Focus on how far you have come in life rather than looking at the accomplishments of others.
h:
“Focus on how far you have come in life rather than looking at the accomplishments of others.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: It is important to fight and fight again, and keep fighting, for only then can evil be kept at bay though never quite eradicated.
h:
“It is important to fight and fight again, and keep fighting, for only then can evil be kept at bay though never quite eradicated.” —
Albus Dumbledore

q: Keep your eyes on the stars, but remember to keep your feet on the ground.
h:
“Keep your eyes on the stars, but remember to keep your feet on the ground.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: Those who attain the middle Dominate the whole.
h:
“Those who attain the middle Dominate the whole.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: It always seems impossible until it's done.
h:
“It always seems impossible until it's done.” —
Nelson Mandela

q: Unless a man is master of his soul, all other kinds of mastery amount to little.
h:
“Unless a man is master of his soul, all other kinds of mastery amount to little.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: The few who do are the envy of the many who only watch.
h:
“The few who do are the envy of the many who only watch.” —
Jim Rohn

q: Life is from the inside out. When you shift on the inside, life shifts on the outside.
h:
“Life is from the inside out. When you shift on the inside, life shifts on the outside.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: Remembering that you are going to die is the best way I know to avoid the trap of thinking you have something to lose.
h:
“Remembering that you are going to die is the best way I know to avoid the trap of thinking you have something to lose.” —
Steve Jobs

q: It is only depth of character that determines the profundity with which we face life.
h:
“It is only depth of character that determines the profundity with which we face life.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: It's better to have a short life that is full of what you like doing, than a long life spent in a miserable way.
h:
“It's better to have a short life that is full of what you like doing, than a long life spent in a miserable way.” —
Alan Watts

q: Money is only a tool. It will take you wherever you wish, but it will not replace you as the driver.
h:
“Money is only a tool. It will take you wherever you wish, but it will not replace you as the driver.” —
Ayn Rand

q: Live and act within the limit of your knowledge and keep expanding it to the limit of your life.
h:
“Live and act within the limit of your knowledge and keep expanding it to the limit of your life.” —
Ayn Rand

q: An inventor is a man who asks Why? of the universe and lets nothing stand between the answer and his mind.
h:
“An inventor is a man who asks Why? of the universe and lets nothing stand between the answer and his mind.” —
Ayn Rand

q: Don't gain the world and lose your soul. Wisdom is better than silver and gold.
h:
“Don't gain the world and lose your soul. Wisdom is better than silver and gold.” —
Bob Marley

q: Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.
h:
“Life isn't about finding yourself. Life is about creating yourself.” —
George Bernard Shaw

q: Nothing makes a man broad-minded like adversity.
h:
“Nothing makes a man broad-minded like adversity.” —
Will Rogers

q: Just try to be the best you can be; never cease trying to be the best you can be. That's in your power.
h:
“Just try to be the best you can be; never cease trying to be the best you can be. That's in your power.” —
John Wooden

q: The past has no power over the present moment.
h:
“The past has no power over the present moment. ” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: Our view of the world is truly shaped by what we decide to hear.
h:
“Our view of the world is truly shaped by what we decide to hear.” —
William James

q: We must not sit down and wait for miracles. Up and be going!
h:
“We must not sit down and wait for miracles. Up and be going!” —
John Eliot

q: Just throw away all thoughts of imaginary things, and stand firm in that which you are.
h:
“Just throw away all thoughts of imaginary things, and stand firm in that which you are.” —
Kabir

q: Fools talk, cowards are silent, wise men listen.
h:
“Fools talk, cowards are silent, wise men listen.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: Walk slowly but never walk backward.
h:
“Walk slowly but never walk backward.” —
Unknown

q: We learn to walk by falling down. If we never fell down, we would never walk.
h:
“We learn to walk by falling down. If we never fell down, we would never walk.” —
Robert Kiyosaki

q: If you love somebody, let them go, for if they return, they were always yours. If they don't, they never were.
h:
“If you love somebody, let them go, for if they return, they were always yours. If they don't, they never were.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: We must not be afraid of dreaming the seemingly impossible if we want the seemingly impossible to become a reality.
h:
“We must not be afraid of dreaming the seemingly impossible if we want the seemingly impossible to become a reality.” —
Vaclav Havel

q: Whoever is happy will make others happy too.
h:
“Whoever is happy will make others happy too.” —
Anne Frank

q: When you are talented you do it whatever it is until your fingers bleed or your eyes are ready to fall out of your head.
h:
“When you are talented you do it whatever it is until your fingers bleed or your eyes are ready to fall out of your head.” —
Stephen King

q: Wherever there is danger, there lurks opportunity; wherever there is opportunity, there lurks danger. The two are inseparable.
h:
“Wherever there is danger, there lurks opportunity; wherever there is opportunity, there lurks danger. The two are inseparable.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: Projecting your mind into a successful situation is the most powerful means to achieve goals.
h:
“Projecting your mind into a successful situation is the most powerful means to achieve goals. ” —
Estee Lauder

q: Give credit where credit is due: simply said, if you want loyalty and best effort, you must be thoughtful.
h:
“Give credit where credit is due: simply said, if you want loyalty and best effort, you must be thoughtful. ” —
Estee Lauder

q: We suffer for the simple reason that suffering is biologically useful. It is nature's preferred agent for inspiring change.
h:
“We suffer for the simple reason that suffering is biologically useful. It is nature's preferred agent for inspiring change.” —
Mark Manson

q: The secret of getting ahead is getting started.
h:
“The secret of getting ahead is getting started.” —
Mark Twain

q: Dreams are the royal road to the unconscious.
h:
“Dreams are the royal road to the unconscious. ” —
Sigmund Freud

q: I would rather die on my feet than live on my knees.
h:
“I would rather die on my feet than live on my knees.” —
Euripides

q: It's not the size of the dog in the fight, it's the size of the fight in the dog.
h:
“It's not the size of the dog in the fight, it's the size of the fight in the dog.” —
Mark Twain

q: Man's character is his fate.
h:
“Man's character is his fate.” —
Heraclitus

q: It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation.
h:
“It is better to fail in originality than to succeed in imitation.” —
Herman Melville

q: He is not a lover who does not love forever.
h:
“He is not a lover who does not love forever.” —
Euripides

q: It is our experiences that mold us into who we are...during times of adversity our true character will show.
h:
“It is our experiences that mold us into who we are...during times of adversity our true character will show.” —
Unknown

q: Have a heart that never hardens, and a temper that never tires, and a touch that never hurts.
h:
“Have a heart that never hardens, and a temper that never tires, and a touch that never hurts.” —
Charles Dickens

q: Throughout this life, you can never be certain of living long enough to take another breath.
h:
“Throughout this life, you can never be certain of living long enough to take another breath.” —
Huang Po

q: When it is dark enough, you can see the stars.
h:
“When it is dark enough, you can see the stars.” —
Ralph Waldo Emerson

q: Give more than you think you can, trusting that you are richer than you think.
h:
“Give more than you think you can, trusting that you are richer than you think.” —
Jon Kabat-Zinn

q: There are people who have money and people who are rich.
h:
“There are people who have money and people who are rich.” —
Coco Chanel

q: A tiny change today brings a dramatically different tomorrow.
h:
“A tiny change today brings a dramatically different tomorrow.” —
Richard Bach

q: You are what you believe in. You become that which you believe you can become.
h:
“You are what you believe in. You become that which you believe you can become.” —
Bhagavad Gita

q: The heart wants what it wants. There's no logic.
h:
“The heart wants what it wants. There's no logic. ” —
Woody Allen

q: Even the smallest person can change the course of the future.
h:
“Even the smallest person can change the course of the future.” —
J.R.R. Tolkien

q: Where your talents and the needs of the world cross, there lies your vocation.
h:
“Where your talents and the needs of the world cross, there lies your vocation.” —
Aristotle

q: Our anxiety does not empty tomorrow of its sorrows, but only empties today of its strengths.
h:
“Our anxiety does not empty tomorrow of its sorrows, but only empties today of its strengths.” —
Charles Spurgeon

q: There is nothing more frightful than ignorance in action.
h:
“There is nothing more frightful than ignorance in action.” —
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

q: Much learning does not teach understanding.
h:
“Much learning does not teach understanding.” —
Heraclitus

q: No one can compete with you on being you. Most of life is a search for who and what needs you the most.
h:
“No one can compete with you on being you. Most of life is a search for who and what needs you the most.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: The beautiful journey of today can only begin when we learn to let go of yesterday.
h:
“The beautiful journey of today can only begin when we learn to let go of yesterday.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: Only when you can be extremely pliable and soft can you be extremely hard and strong.
h:
“Only when you can be extremely pliable and soft can you be extremely hard and strong.” —
Zen Proverb

q: Duty makes us do things well, but love makes us do them beautifully.
h:
“Duty makes us do things well, but love makes us do them beautifully. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Inspire yourself to be great. Being good isn't good enough.
h:
“Inspire yourself to be great. Being good isn't good enough.” —
Gurbaksh Chahal

q: Normal is the average of deviance.
h:
“Normal is the average of deviance.” —
Rita Mae Brown

q: Laziness may appear attractive, but work gives satisfaction.
h:
“Laziness may appear attractive, but work gives satisfaction.” —
Anne Frank

q: It's your outlook on life that counts.
h:
“It's your outlook on life that counts.” —
Betty White

q: Do not wait for leaders; do it alone, person to person.
h:
“Do not wait for leaders; do it alone, person to person.” —
Mother Teresa

q: We are all like the bright moon, we still have our darker side.
h:
“We are all like the bright moon, we still have our darker side. ” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: Don't let the past steal your present.
h:
“Don't let the past steal your present.” —
Cherralea Morgen

q: If I can stop one heart from breaking, I shall not live in vain.
h:
“If I can stop one heart from breaking, I shall not live in vain.” —
Emily Dickinson

q: Engage in those actions and thoughts that nurture the good qualities you want to have.
h:
“Engage in those actions and thoughts that nurture the good qualities you want to have.” —

q: If you want to turn a vision into reality, you have to give 100% and never stop believing in your dream.
h:
“If you want to turn a vision into reality, you have to give 100% and never stop believing in your dream.” —
Arnold Schwarzenegger

q: It's OK to have your eggs in one basket as long as you control what happens to that basket.
h:
“It's OK to have your eggs in one basket as long as you control what happens to that basket.” —
Elon Musk

q: You can start changing our world for the better daily, no matter how small the action.
h:
“You can start changing our world for the better daily, no matter how small the action.” —
Nelson Mandela

q: Make failure your teacher, not your undertaker.
h:
“Make failure your teacher, not your undertaker. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: The more you like yourself, the less you are like anyone else, which makes you unique.
h:
“The more you like yourself, the less you are like anyone else, which makes you unique.” —
Walt Disney

q: Your neighbor is the man who needs you.
h:
“Your neighbor is the man who needs you.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: The Truth is realized in an instant; the Act is practiced step by step.
h:
“The Truth is realized in an instant; the Act is practiced step by step.” —
Seungsahn

q: When you're at the end of your rope, tie a knot and hold on.
h:
“When you're at the end of your rope, tie a knot and hold on.” —
Theodore Roosevelt

q: To belittle, you have to be little.
h:
“To belittle, you have to be little.” —
Kahlil Gibran

q: Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone elses. life. Don't be trapped by dogma - which is living with the results of other people's thinking.
h:
“Your time is limited, so don't waste it living someone elses. life. Don't be trapped by dogma - which is living with the results of other people's thinking.” —
Steve Jobs

q: Let my soul smile through my heart and my heart smile through my eyes, that I may scatter rich smiles in sad hearts.
h:
“Let my soul smile through my heart and my heart smile through my eyes, that I may scatter rich smiles in sad hearts. ” —
Paramahansa Yogananda

q: There is no one giant step that does it. It's a lot of little steps.
h:
“There is no one giant step that does it. It's a lot of little steps.” —
Peter A. Cohen

q: A path is made by walking on it.
h:
“A path is made by walking on it.” —
Zhuangzi

q: To create more positive results in your life, replace 'if only' with 'next time'.
h:
“To create more positive results in your life, replace 'if only' with 'next time'.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.
h:
“Success is not final, failure is not fatal: it is the courage to continue that counts.” —
Winston Churchill

q: The more you trust yourself, the less you compare yourself to others.
h:
“The more you trust yourself, the less you compare yourself to others.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Everything that is made beautiful and fair and lovely is made for the eye of one who sees.
h:
“Everything that is made beautiful and fair and lovely is made for the eye of one who sees.” —
Rumi

q: Let not your mind run on what you lack as much as on what you have already.
h:
“Let not your mind run on what you lack as much as on what you have already.” —
Marcus Aurelius

q: If you do not get the chills when you set your goal you're not setting big enough goals.
h:
“If you do not get the chills when you set your goal you're not setting big enough goals.” —
Bob Proctor

q: When you are tempted to give up, your breakthrough is probably just around the corner.
h:
“When you are tempted to give up, your breakthrough is probably just around the corner.” —
Joyce Meyer

q: Who you are is always right.
h:
“Who you are is always right.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Without struggle, no progress and no result. Every breaking of habit produces a change in the machine.
h:
“Without struggle, no progress and no result. Every breaking of habit produces a change in the machine.” —
G.I. Gurdjieff

q: The wisest men follow their own direction.
h:
“The wisest men follow their own direction.” —
Euripides

q: Give more than you think you can, trusting that you are richer than you think.
h:
“Give more than you think you can, trusting that you are richer than you think.” —
Jon Kabat-Zinn

q: Lack of direction, not lack of time, is the problem. We all have twenty-four hour days.
h:
“Lack of direction, not lack of time, is the problem. We all have twenty-four hour days.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Great loves too must be endured.
h:
“Great loves too must be endured.” —
Coco Chanel

q: It doesn't matter what you do, only how well you do it.
h:
“It doesn't matter what you do, only how well you do it.” —
Dan Millman

q: An approximate answer to the right question is worth a great deal more than a precise answer to the wrong question.
h:
“An approximate answer to the right question is worth a great deal more than a precise answer to the wrong question.” —
John Tukey

q: Discipline is the mark of intelligent living.
h:
“Discipline is the mark of intelligent living.” —
Sathya Sai Baba

q: Happiness is a quality of the soul...not a function of one's material circumstances.
h:
“Happiness is a quality of the soul...not a function of one's material circumstances.” —
Aristotle

q: I wasn't brave, I just didn't have time to be scared.
h:
“I wasn't brave, I just didn't have time to be scared.” —
Amelia Earhart

q: Nothing can bring you peace but yourself.
h:
“Nothing can bring you peace but yourself.” —
Dale Carnegie

q: You have to accept whatever comes, and the only important thing is that you meet it with the best you have to give.
h:
“You have to accept whatever comes, and the only important thing is that you meet it with the best you have to give.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: Outstanding people have one thing in common: an absolute sense of mission.
h:
“Outstanding people have one thing in common: an absolute sense of mission. ” —
Zig Ziglar

q: Time is a game played beautifully by children.
h:
“Time is a game played beautifully by children.” —
Heraclitus

q: The attempt to escape from pain, is what creates more pain.
h:
“The attempt to escape from pain, is what creates more pain.” —
Gabor Mate

q: The people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world are the ones who do.
h:
“The people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world are the ones who do.” —
Steve Jobs

q: Everything flows, nothing stands still.
h:
“Everything flows, nothing stands still.” —
Heraclitus

q: Everything is created twice, first in the mind and then in reality.
h:
“Everything is created twice, first in the mind and then in reality.” —
Robin Sharma

q: It's not how much we give but how much love we put into giving.
h:
“It's not how much we give but how much love we put into giving.” —
Mother Teresa

q: Today is plenty; right now is enough. Tomorrow will come in good time. Until it does, live the depth of now.
h:
“Today is plenty; right now is enough. Tomorrow will come in good time. Until it does, live the depth of now.” —
Ralph Marston

q: Take care of your body. It's the only place you have to live.
h:
“Take care of your body. It's the only place you have to live.” —
Jim Rohn

q: The secret of life isn't what happens to you, but what you do with what happens to you.
h:
“The secret of life isn't what happens to you, but what you do with what happens to you.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
h:
“A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Life needs to be more than just solving problems every day. You need to wake up and be excited about the future.
h:
“Life needs to be more than just solving problems every day. You need to wake up and be excited about the future.” —
Elon Musk

q: When you move beyond your fear, you feel free.
h:
“When you move beyond your fear, you feel free.” —
Spencer Johnson

q: The mind that turns ever outward Will have no end to craving. Only the mind turned inward Will find a still-point of peace.
h:
“The mind that turns ever outward Will have no end to craving. Only the mind turned inward Will find a still-point of peace.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Most people get ahead during the time that others waste.
h:
“Most people get ahead during the time that others waste.” —
Henry Ford

q: Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak.
h:
“Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak.” —
Sun Tzu

q: When you can't make them see the light, make them feel the heat.
h:
“When you can't make them see the light, make them feel the heat.” —
Ronald Reagan

q: Problems remain as problems because people are busy defending them rather than finding solutions.
h:
“Problems remain as problems because people are busy defending them rather than finding solutions.” —
Celestine Chua

q: Stress happens when the mind resists what is.
h:
“Stress happens when the mind resists what is.” —
Dan Millman

q: It is better to disappoint people with the truth than to appease them with a lie.
h:
“It is better to disappoint people with the truth than to appease them with a lie.” —
Simon Sinek

q: I admire those who do good and expect nothing in return.
h:
“I admire those who do good and expect nothing in return.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: It is secondary whether we choose belief or defiance. What is precious is that we are always able to choose.
h:
“It is secondary whether we choose belief or defiance. What is precious is that we are always able to choose.” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Forget safety. Live where you fear to live.
h:
“Forget safety. Live where you fear to live.” —
Rumi

q: How many times do you have to get hit over the head until you figure out who's hitting you?
h:
“How many times do you have to get hit over the head until you figure out who's hitting you?” —
Harry S. Truman

q: Success comes to those who become success conscious.
h:
“Success comes to those who become success conscious.” —
Napoleon Hill

q: Don't be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.
h:
“Don't be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: Without the rain there would be no rainbow.
h:
“Without the rain there would be no rainbow.” —
Gilbert Chesterton

q: The past has no power over the present moment.
h:
“The past has no power over the present moment. ” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and man.
h:
“If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and man.” —
Mark Twain

q: Trust is the foundation of great leadership.
h:
“Trust is the foundation of great leadership.” —
Lolly Daskal

q: Ability is a poor man's wealth.
h:
“Ability is a poor man's wealth.” —
John Wooden

q: No one ever said life was fair. Just Eventful.
h:
“No one ever said life was fair. Just Eventful.” —
Carol Burnett

q: Your world is a living expression of how you are using and have used your mind.
h:
“Your world is a living expression of how you are using and have used your mind.” —
Earl Nightingale

q: If life were predictable it would cease to be life, and be without flavor.
h:
“If life were predictable it would cease to be life, and be without flavor.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

q: We should not look back unless it is to derive useful lessons from past errors.
h:
“We should not look back unless it is to derive useful lessons from past errors.” —
George Washington

q: Never feel shame for trying and failing, for he who has never failed is he who has never tried.
h:
“Never feel shame for trying and failing, for he who has never failed is he who has never tried.” —
Og Mandino

q: Fools resist. The wise embrace.
h:
“Fools resist. The wise embrace.” —
Maxime Lagace

q: The more you are motivated by Love, The more Fearless & Free your action will be.
h:
“The more you are motivated by Love, The more Fearless & Free your action will be.” —
Dalai Lama

q: When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.
h:
“When I let go of what I am, I become what I might be.” —
Lao Tzu

q: A pessimist is one who makes difficulties of his opportunities and an optimist is one who makes opportunities of his difficulties.
h:
“A pessimist is one who makes difficulties of his opportunities and an optimist is one who makes opportunities of his difficulties.” —
Harry S. Truman

q: If you change the way you look at things, the things you look at change.
h:
“If you change the way you look at things, the things you look at change. ” —
Wayne Dyer

q: The difference between treason and patriotism is only a matter of dates.
h:
“The difference between treason and patriotism is only a matter of dates.” —
Alexandre Dumas

q: Learn only how to avoid seeking for and attaching yourselves to anything.
h:
“Learn only how to avoid seeking for and attaching yourselves to anything.” —
Huang Po

q: Mastering others is strength, mastering yourself is true power.
h:
“Mastering others is strength, mastering yourself is true power.” —
Lao Tzu

q: Do every act of your life as if it were your last.
h:
“Do every act of your life as if it were your last.” —
Marcus Aurelius

q: Do good, live in the most positive and joyful way possible every day.
h:
“Do good, live in the most positive and joyful way possible every day.” —
Roy T. Bennett

q: By seeking and blundering we learn.
h:
“By seeking and blundering we learn.” —
Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

q: What a liberation to realize that 'the voice in my head' is not who I am. Who am I then? The one who sees that.
h:
“What a liberation to realize that 'the voice in my head' is not who I am. Who am I then? The one who sees that.” —
Eckhart Tolle

q: Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get.
h:
“Success is getting what you want. Happiness is wanting what you get.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: Forgive yourself for your faults and your mistakes and move on.
h:
“Forgive yourself for your faults and your mistakes and move on.” —
Les Brown

q: As a matter of fact is an expression that precedes many an expression that isn't.
h:
“As a matter of fact is an expression that precedes many an expression that isn't.” —
Laurence J. Peter

q: I never said it would be easy, I only said it would be worth it.
h:
“I never said it would be easy, I only said it would be worth it.” —
Mae West

q: Everyone you admire was once a beginner.
h:
“Everyone you admire was once a beginner.” —
Jack Butcher

q: We create the world and ourselves;
h:
“We create the world and ourselves;” —
Ming-Dao Deng

q: Great things are not done by impulse, but by a series of small things brought together.
h:
“Great things are not done by impulse, but by a series of small things brought together.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: The most important thing in life is to stop saying 'I wish' and start saying 'I will'. Consider nothing impossible, then treat possibilities as probabilities.
h:
“The most important thing in life is to stop saying 'I wish' and start saying 'I will'. Consider nothing impossible, then treat possibilities as probabilities.” —
Charles Dickens

q: No matter how smart we may think we are, no matter how committed we are to our truth, we can lose our way.
h:
“No matter how smart we may think we are, no matter how committed we are to our truth, we can lose our way.” —
Kamal Ravikant

q: Everyone can rise above their circumstances and achieve success if they are dedicated to and passionate about what they do.
h:
“Everyone can rise above their circumstances and achieve success if they are dedicated to and passionate about what they do.” —
Nelson Mandela

q: Follow the man who seeks the truth; run from the man who has found it.
h:
“Follow the man who seeks the truth; run from the man who has found it.” —
Vaclav Havel

q: It still holds true that man is most uniquely human when he turns obstacles into opportunities.
h:
“It still holds true that man is most uniquely human when he turns obstacles into opportunities.” —
Eric Hoffer

q: Create with the heart; build with the mind.
h:
“Create with the heart; build with the mind.” —
Criss Jami

q: Better the cottage where one is merry than the palace where one weeps.
h:
“Better the cottage where one is merry than the palace where one weeps.” —
Chinese Proverb

q: Even a hare will bite when it is cornered.
h:
“Even a hare will bite when it is cornered. ” —
Chinese Proverb

q: It is better to change an opinion than to persist in a wrong one.
h:
“It is better to change an opinion than to persist in a wrong one.” —
Socrates

q: People with clear, written goals, accomplish far more in a shorter period of time than people without them could ever imagine.
h:
“People with clear, written goals, accomplish far more in a shorter period of time than people without them could ever imagine.” —
Brian Tracy

q: You can calculate the worth of a man by the number of his enemies.
h:
“You can calculate the worth of a man by the number of his enemies.” —
Gustave Flaubert

q: The only person you should try to be better than is the person you were yesterday.
h:
“The only person you should try to be better than is the person you were yesterday.” —
Brian Tracy

q: Evil is whatever distracts.
h:
“Evil is whatever distracts. ” —
Franz Kafka

q: It is passion that makes man live; wisdom makes one only last.
h:
“It is passion that makes man live; wisdom makes one only last.” —
Nicolas Chamfort

q: The only way to 'find out if it will work out' is to do it.
h:
“The only way to 'find out if it will work out' is to do it.” —
Simon Sinek

q: If they wrote it to make money, don't read it.
h:
“If they wrote it to make money, don't read it.” —
Naval Ravikant

q: You will succeed because most people are lazy.
h:
“You will succeed because most people are lazy.” —
Shahir Zag

q: Anyone who stops learning is old, whether at twenty or eighty. Anyone who keeps learning stays young.
h:
“Anyone who stops learning is old, whether at twenty or eighty. Anyone who keeps learning stays young. ” —
Henry Ford

q: Mistakes are painful when they happen, but years later a collection of mistakes is what is called experience.
h:
“Mistakes are painful when they happen, but years later a collection of mistakes is what is called experience.” —
Denis Waitley

q: Keep your dreams, you never know when you might need them.
h:
“Keep your dreams, you never know when you might need them.” —
Carlos Ruiz Zafon

q: If you don't read the newspaper, you're uninformed. If you read the newspaper, you're misinformed.
h:
“If you don't read the newspaper, you're uninformed. If you read the newspaper, you're misinformed.” —
Mark Twain

q: Letting go means to come to the realization that some people are a part of your history, but not a part of your destiny.
h:
“Letting go means to come to the realization that some people are a part of your history, but not a part of your destiny.” —
Steve Maraboli

q: The first man gets the oyster, the second man gets the shell.
h:
“The first man gets the oyster, the second man gets the shell.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: If you throw away all thoughts of attainment, you will then come to see the real purpose of your quest.
h:
“If you throw away all thoughts of attainment, you will then come to see the real purpose of your quest.” —
Seungsahn

q: Reversing your treatment of the man you have wronged is better than asking his forgiveness.
h:
“Reversing your treatment of the man you have wronged is better than asking his forgiveness.” —
Elbert Hubbard

q: Confidence is contagious. So is lack of confidence.
h:
“Confidence is contagious. So is lack of confidence.” —
Vince Lombardi

q: If you are ever the smartest person in the room, you are in the wrong room.
h:
“If you are ever the smartest person in the room, you are in the wrong room.” —
C. Sean McGee

q: There are only two ways to live your life. One is as if nothing is a miracle. The other is as if everything is a miracle.
h:
“There are only two ways to live your life. One is as if nothing is a miracle. The other is as if everything is a miracle.” —
Albert Einstein

q: Do not anticipate trouble, or worry about what may never happen. Keep in the sunlight.
h:
“Do not anticipate trouble, or worry about what may never happen. Keep in the sunlight.” —
Benjamin Franklin

q: We have a duty to maintain the light of consciousness to make sure it continues into the future.
h:
“We have a duty to maintain the light of consciousness to make sure it continues into the future.” —
Elon Musk

q: You can calculate the worth of a man by the number of his enemies.
h:
“You can calculate the worth of a man by the number of his enemies.” —
Gustave Flaubert

q: Because of your smile, you make life more beautiful.
h:
“Because of your smile, you make life more beautiful.” —
Thich Nhat Hanh

q: Success is liking yourself, liking what you do, and liking how you do it.
h:
“Success is liking yourself, liking what you do, and liking how you do it.” —
Maya Angelou

q: The major difference between the big shot and the little shot is the big shot is just a little shot who kept on shooting.
h:
“The major difference between the big shot and the little shot is the big shot is just a little shot who kept on shooting.” —
Zig Ziglar

q: The more we have the less we own.
h:
“The more we have the less we own.” —
Meister Eckhart

q: Expect the best, plan for the worst, and prepare to be surprised.
h:
“Expect the best, plan for the worst, and prepare to be surprised. ” —
Denis Waitley

q: Words are clothes that thoughts wear
h:
“Words are clothes that thoughts wear” —
Samuel Butler

q: Just get out and do it. You will be very, very glad that you did.
h:
“Just get out and do it. You will be very, very glad that you did.” —
Christopher McCandless

q: Identify your problems, but give your power and energy to solutions.
h:
“Identify your problems, but give your power and energy to solutions.” —

q: Resilience is not what happens to you. It's how you react to, respond to, and recover from what happens to you.
h:
“Resilience is not what happens to you. It's how you react to, respond to, and recover from what happens to you.” —
Jeffrey Gitomer

q: Not until we are lost do we begin to understand ourselves.
h:
“Not until we are lost do we begin to understand ourselves.” —
Henry David Thoreau

q: When you're at the end of your rope, tie a knot and hold on.
h:
“When you're at the end of your rope, tie a knot and hold on.” —

q: The more you lose yourself in something bigger than yourself, the more energy you will have.
h:
“The more you lose yourself in something bigger than yourself, the more energy you will have.” —
Norman Vincent Peale

q: Normality is a paved road: It's comfortable to walk, but no flowers grow on it.
h:
“Normality is a paved road: It's comfortable to walk, but no flowers grow on it.” —
Vincent van Gogh

q: A person without a sense of humor is like a wagon without springs, jolted by every pebble in the road.
h:
“A person without a sense of humor is like a wagon without springs, jolted by every pebble in the road.” —
Henry Ward Beecher

q: Tall oaks grow from little acorns.
h:
“Tall oaks grow from little acorns.” —
Andrew Carnegie

q: Most great people have achieved their greatest success just one step beyond their greatest failure.
h:
“Most great people have achieved their greatest success just one step beyond their greatest failure.” —

q: When you are talented you do it whatever it is until your fingers bleed or your eyes are ready to fall out of your head.
h:

q: We are born from a quiet sleep, and we die to a calm awakening
h:

q: The greatest of all mistakes is to do nothing because you think you can only do a little.
h:

q: A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.
h:
“A journey of a thousand miles must begin with a single step.” —

q: Thinking is the hardest work there is. That is why so few people engage in it.
h:
“Thinking is the hardest work there is. That is why so few people engage in it.” —

q: Pain doesn't last. And when it's gone, we have something to show for it. Growth.
h:

q: To raise your consciousness, surround yourself with people of higher consciousness.
h:

q: Everyone is a moon, and has a dark side which he never shows to anybody.
h:
“Everyone is a moon, and has a dark side which he never shows to anybody.” —

q: Don't just sit there. Do something. The answers will follow.
h:
“Don't just sit there. Do something. The answers will follow.” —

q: Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive.
h:

Elbert Hubbard

q: You are never too old to become younger.
h:
“You are never too old to become younger.” —

q: It is not fair to ask of others what you are not willing to do yourself.
h:

q: If we are not able to smile, then the world will not have peace.
h:
“If we are not able to smile, then the world will not have peace.” —

q: Life does not get better by chance, it gets better by change.
h:

q: I must also have a dark side if I am to be whole.
h:

q: Human beings believe just as they breathe - in order to survive.

q: Living life in style also means living a life of balance.

q: The people who are crazy enough to think they can change the world are the ones who do.

q: The art of being wise is knowing what to overlook.

q: Attitude drives actions. Actions drive results. Results drive lifestyles.
h:

q: Nothing external to you has any power over you.

q: There is no way to happiness - happiness is the way.

q: It doesn't matter where you are coming from. All that matters is where you are going.
h:

q: The art of being wise is knowing what to overlook.
h:
“The art of being wise is knowing what to overlook.” —
William James

q: It always seems impossible until it's done.
h:

q: Invisible things are the only realities.
h:

q: The Law of Concentration states that whatever you dwell upon grows. The more you think about something, the more it becomes part of your reality.
h:

q: You don't need to be better than anyone else, you just need to be better than you used to be.
h:

q: Men are equal; it is not birth but virtue that makes the difference.

q: If you do not push the boundaries, you will never know where they are.
h:

q: A crisis is an opportunity riding the dangerous wind.
h:

q: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
h:

q: Everything has its beauty, but not everyone sees it.
h:

q: Not doing it is certainly the best way to not getting it.
h:

q: The purpose of life is the expansion of happiness.
h:

q: Whatever we plant in our subconscious mind and nourish with repetition and emotion will one day become reality.
h:

q: It's your life-but only if you make it so.
h:

q: The chief danger in life is that you may take too many precautions.
h:

q: You get paid in direct proportion to the difficulty of problems you solve.

q: Life is love and love is life.
h:

q: Forget mistakes. Forget failure. Forget everything except what you are going to do now and do it. Today is your lucky day!
h:

q: I am not absentminded. It is the presence of mind that makes me unaware of everything else.
h:

q: Youth has no age.
h:

q: Your purpose will be clear only when you listen to your heart.
h:

q: Silence is a source of great strength.
h:

q: If you set your goals ridiculously high and its a failure, you will fail above everyone elses success.
h:

q: You're on earth. There's no cure for that.
h:

q: I alone cannot change the world, but I can cast a stone across the waters to create many ripples.
h:

q: Don't just sit there. Do something. The answers will follow.
h:

q: Cry. Forgive. Learn. Move on. Let your tears water the seeds of your future happiness.

q: We must be free not because we claim freedom, but because we practice it.

q: The greatest enemy of knowledge is not ignorance, it's the illusion of knowledge.

q: Words can only have a positive effect on others if and when they are ready to listen.
h:

q: Rewards and punishment is the lowest form of education.

q: The more you are grateful for what you have the more you will have to be grateful for.

q: It is not titles that honour men, but men that honour titles.

q: Do not believe that you will reach your destination without leaving the shore.
h:

q: You are the only real obstacle in your path to a fulfilling life.
h:

q: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
h:

q: A single act of kindness throws out roots in all directions, and the roots spring up and make new trees.
h:

q: Take care of your body. It's the only place you have to live.
h:

q: Prefer to be defeated in the presence of the wise than to excel among fools.
h:

q: Victims recite problems, leaders provide solutions.

q: What a liberation to realize that 'the voice in my head' is not who I am. Who am I then? The one who sees that.
h:

q: Meanings are not determined by situations, but we determine ourselves by the meanings we give to situations.
h:

q: Doing the best at this moment puts you in the best place for the next moment.
h:

q: Silence is sometimes the best answer.
h:
“Silence is sometimes the best answer.” —
Dalai Lama

q: My guiding principle is this: Guilt is never to be doubted.
h:
“My guiding principle is this: Guilt is never to be doubted. ” —

q: In a world of change, the learners shall inherit the earth, while the learned shall find themselves perfectly suited for a world that no longer exists.
h:

q: People often say that motivation doesn't last. Well, neither does bathing - that's why we recommend it daily.
h:

q: Re-examine all that you have been told... dismiss that which insults your soul.
